description.en: Seminars are held in preparation for Gottlob Frege lectures in theoretical philosophy, where relevant texts provided by the lecturer are discussed. Participation in preparatory seminars, Frege lectures, and the related workshop (if offered that year) is required.
description.et: Gottlob Frege nimeliste teoreetilise filosoofia loengute ettevalmistuseks peetakse seminare, kus käsitletakse lektori teemakohaseid tekste. Vajalik on osalemine ettevalmistavatel seminaridel, Frege loengutel ja loengutega seotud töötoas (juhul kui see antud aastal toimub).

objectives.en: The course aims to prepare students for the annual Gottlob Frege lectures held by a philosopher of international caliber, enable them to attend Frege lectures and participate in the related workshop, and reflect upon the lectures.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on valmistada üliõpilasi ette osalemiseks iga-aastastel Frege loengutel, mida peab rahvusvaheliselt tunnustatud külaline, võimaldada neil mõista Frege loengute ja loengutele järgneva töötoa teemasid ning õpitu üle reflekteerida.

learning_outcomes.en: A student who has completed the course can understand the content of Frege lectures and engage in reflection on them.
learning_outcomes.et: Õppeaine läbinud üliõpilane saab aru Frege loengute sisust, oskab loengute teemadel kaasa mõtelda ning õpitu üle reflekteerida.

independent_work.et: * Writing a small essay  "What did I learn at Frege lectures?" (1500 words)

description.et:
Frege Lectures 2024 (November 4-6) held by Emma Borg (London)
* Attending all the lectures

Workshop "Interpretivism, mental fictionalism and folk psychology", 7.-8.11.24. 
* Attending the workshop

Writing a small essay "What did I learn at Frege lectures?" (1500 words)
Please send your essays to Bruno Mölder (bruno.moelder@ut.ee).
Essay deadline: 18.11.2024

grade_preconditions.et:
* Participating at all the lectures/seminars (preparatory seminar, Frege Lectures 2024, Workshop)
* Writing a small essay  "What did I learn at Frege lectures?" (1-2 pp)
Please send your essays to Bruno Mölder (bruno.moelder@ut.ee).
Essay deadline: 18.11.2024

grade_evaluation.et: Based on your attendance and essay.

debt_elimination.et: If you missed the lectures... Wait for next year.

resources.mandatory_materials:
* Frege Lectures 2024 (November 4-6)  held by Emma Borg (London)
See more details at: https://filsem.ut.ee/en/content/frege-lectures
Compulsory reading materials can be found at Moodle.

Borg, Emma (2022). In Defence of Individual Rationality. Proceedings of the Aristotelian Society 122 (3):195-217.
Borg, Emma (2018). 'On deflationary accounts of human action understanding', Review of Philosophy and Psychology 9: 503-522

description.et: Frege Lectures 2024 (04.-06.11.2024.) held by Emma Borg (London)
